messages: 18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (06:33): I'm trying to find a way to boot from a cd rom, read an ntfs drive, and then copy files to a usb drive.  Any suggestions?
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:33): tempered: i think knoppix does that
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (06:34): I'm not familar but I know it's a linux flavor, can you be more specific?
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:34): tempered: knoppix is a liveCD, and i think it has NTFS built in
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:35): most linux distros can read NTFS these days, its writing thats an issue
a76873910ff98ecc4e522cb60d3aa22d (06:35): knoppix does have ntfs support
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (06:35): my usb drive is an ntfs partition
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:35): thats tricky
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:36): yeah
ca1ec897bcf7706d7f4f3ab3ebbab3c7 (06:36): Psi-Jack, you there
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:36): knoppix has read/write on NTFS
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:36): http://www.knoppix.org/
a76873910ff98ecc4e522cb60d3aa22d (06:36): "write"
a76873910ff98ecc4e522cb60d3aa22d (06:37): it can only write to equally sized files
a76873910ff98ecc4e522cb60d3aa22d (06:37): and with great difficulty
fb4dbbe2a70f6a0a0eaa10dead26c669 (06:37): well
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (06:37): so do I partition the usb into a bunch of fat32 drives?
a76873910ff98ecc4e522cb60d3aa22d (06:37): sure, you could do that
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (06:39): thanks.  Gonna try it and probably go to sleep lol :)

9a56dbef7f7a1b2503d0cf89675b40ea (06:43): get linux

ca1ec897bcf7706d7f4f3ab3ebbab3c7 (06:47): icarus, has to expand dhcp scope ;)
716ac33f581b6cbc15f40e51bc3652aa (06:48): vipersniper: he need to specify the interface that he wants to renew. ipconfig has a field to do just that
